SEARCH
Package model.entities

Class Seat

java.lang.Object
model.entities.Seat
public class Seat extends Object
Represents a seat in the train system. Each seat has a unique identifier and can be either booked or available. The class provides methods to manage the booking status of the seat.
Author:
Yelyzaveta Tkachenko, Bianca Buzdugan

  • Constructor Details

    • Seat

      public Seat(int seatId)
      Constructs a new Seat with the specified seat ID. The seat is initially set as available (not booked).
      Parameters:
      seatId - the unique identifier for this seat

  • Method Details

    • getSeatId

      public int getSeatId()
      Gets the seat ID.
      Returns:
      the unique identifier of this seat

    • setSeatId

      public void setSeatId(int seatId)
      Sets the seat ID.
      Parameters:
      seatId - the new unique identifier for this seat

    • isBooked

      public boolean isBooked()
      Checks if the seat is currently booked.
      Returns:
      true if the seat is booked, false if it's available

    • setBooked

      public void setBooked()
      Sets the seat status to booked. This method directly sets the booking status to true without any validation.

    • setAvailable

      public void setAvailable()
      Sets the seat status to available. This method directly sets the booking status to false, making the seat available for booking.

    • book

      public void book()
      Attempts to book the seat. If the seat is available, it will be marked as booked. If the seat is already booked, a message will be printed to the console.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the Seat object. The format includes the seat ID and its current booking status.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of this Seat showing ID and booking status
